mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On the Scaphisomatini (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Scaphidiinae) of the Philippines, IV: the genera Sapitia ACHARD and Scaphisoma LEACH

subSubSection.paragraph: T y p e m a t e r i a l: Holotype ♀: Burungkot, Upi, Cotabato Prov., Mindanao Elev. 1500 ft. I, 1-9, 1947 / Lot 167; on fermenting sap of freshly cut tree / CNHM-Philippine Zool. Exped. (1946-47) F.G.Werner leg. (FMNH).
E t y m o l o g y: The species epithet is derived from the Latin sub, meaning below, and punctulum, referring to small punctures.

C o m p a r a t i v e n o t e s: This species may be readily distinguished from members of the group as from all other Philippine congeners, with the exception of S. centripunctulum , by the elytral punctation. It is unique in having antennomeres III and IV evenly short in combination with impressed patch of coarse elytral punctures.
